Compliance description: Check if the code includes methods to collect raw data from databases, APIs, sensors, web scraping, or user inputs.
Verify if the code includes logic to extract data from structured (CSV, SQL databases) and unstructured (PDFs, images, text) sources.
Assess whether the code includes functionality to merge multiple data sources while resolving inconsistencies.
Determine if the code implements handling of real-time data streams from IoT devices, event-driven systems, or streaming platforms.
Check if the code supports batch processing mechanisms for large-scale data ingestion.
Assess if the code includes an annotation system for supervised learning tasks, such as manual or automated labeling.
Verify if the code maintains structured metadata, including source details, timestamps, and schema definitions.
Ensure that the code implements dataset versioning to track different versions for reproducibility and rollback capabilities.
Check if the code validates incoming data against predefined formats and structures to ensure compliance.
Evaluate whether the code correctly implements storage solutions, such as data lakes, warehouses, or distributed systems, based on requirements.
Check if the code implements logic to identify and remove duplicate records from the dataset.
Verify if the code includes mechanisms to detect and correct or remove corrupt records.
Ensure the code handles missing values through imputation or removal.
Check if the code normalizes or standardizes numerical data (e.g., Min-Max scaling, Z-score normalization).
Assess whether the code derives meaningful new features from raw data.
Verify if the code includes methods to retain only the most important features.
Check if categorical variables are converted into numerical formats (e.g., one-hot encoding, label encoding).
Ensure the code implements oversampling, undersampling, or synthetic data generation (e.g., SMOTE).
Assess if the code applies transformations (e.g., image flipping, text paraphrasing) to expand the dataset.
Verify if the code correctly converts data types, parses timestamps, or applies transformations like log scaling.
Check if the code masks or anonymizes sensitive data while preserving analytical utility.
Ensure that the code properly splits data into training, validation, and test sets while maintaining fair distribution.
Verify if the code detects and processes outliers using statistical or ML-based methods.
Assess whether the code includes checks to maintain data quality and consistency throughout preprocessing.
Verify if the code specifies the deployment platform (on-premises, cloud, or edge devices).
Check if the code includes Docker or Kubernetes for deploying the model in a containerized environment.
Ensure the code builds REST or gRPC APIs for serving predictions.
Verify if the code deploys the model using AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Functions, or Azure Functions.
Check if the code includes autoscaling or load balancing to handle high-demand scenarios.
Ensure the code implements authentication, authorization, and encryption for model security.
Verify if the code deploys multiple model versions simultaneously for performance comparison.
Check if the code uses techniques like quantization, pruning, or hardware acceleration to optimize latency.
Ensure the code includes CI/CD mechanisms to automate model deployment and updates.
Check if the code computes relevant metrics such as accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score for classification, or RMSE, MAE for regression.
Verify if the code includes logic to compute and analyze the confusion matrix to assess false positives and false negatives.
Ensure the code calculates and visualizes precision-recall and ROC curves to measure model trade-offs.
Check if the code identifies patterns in incorrect predictions and provides insights for improvement.
Assess whether the code includes techniques to detect and mitigate model biases against specific groups.
Verify if the code uses SHAP, LIME, or feature importance scores to explain model predictions.
Ensure the code compares model performance against traditional baselines or industry standards.
Check if the code allows for testing feature modifications to study their impact on model performance.
Verify if the code includes methods such as Bayesian inference or dropout-based uncertainty estimation.
Ensure that the code applies cross-validation techniques to assess model performance robustness.
Check if the code evaluates the model’s generalization ability using a validation set.
Check if the code includes logic to select the best algorithm (e.g., decision trees, neural networks, transformers) for the task.
Verify if the code properly defines loss functions (e.g., MSE, cross-entropy) and optimization methods (SGD, Adam).
Ensure the code initializes default values for key hyperparameters such as learning rate, batch size, and regularization.
Check if the code optimizes data loading, preprocessing, and augmentation for training.
Assess if the code includes proper logic to train the selected model on the dataset.
Verify if the code implements grid search, random search, or Bayesian optimization for fine-tuning.
Ensure the code correctly splits data into multiple subsets for cross-validation.
Check if the code includes dropout, L1/L2 regularization, or batch normalization to improve generalization.
Assess if the code utilizes GPUs, TPUs, or cloud-based clusters to enhance training efficiency.
Verify if the code adjusts class weights or applies cost-sensitive learning methods.
Check if the code incorporates tools like SHAP, LIME, or attention mechanisms to explain model decisions.
Verify if the code serializes the trained model into a deployable format (e.g., Pickle, ONNX, TensorFlow SavedModel).
Check if the code logs hyperparameters, metrics, and model configurations for reproducibility.
Ensure the code generates unique identifiers (hashes) for each trained model version.
Verify if the code stores models in a registry like MLflow or ModelDB for version control.
Check if the code ensures model compatibility with different deployment environments.

Compliance Check: New vs. Old Model Performance Check
Compliance description: Ensure the code includes logic to compare new model versions against previous versions before deployment.
Verify if the code logs key metrics like accuracy, latency, and throughput in production.
Check if the code includes mechanisms to track shifts in input data distribution.
Ensure the code monitors changes in the relationship between input features and target labels.
Verify if the code automates retraining based on performance decay or data updates.
Check if the code includes mechanisms to detect and flag unexpected predictions.
Ensure the code maintains logs of predictions, failures, and user feedback for debugging.
Verify if the code includes strategies for handling failures, security threats, or biases.
Check if the code tracks CPU, memory, and storage usage for optimization.
